unnormalised: New Delhi: Manufacturing output is facing headwinds as persistent logistics delays plague supply chains, impacting production schedules ahead of the crucial Diwali season. Reports indicate bottlenecks at major ports like Jawaharlal Nehru Port Trust (JNPT) and Chennai Port, causing significant delays in the arrival of raw materials and finished goods.
normalised: New Delhi: Manufacturing output is facing headwinds as persistent logistics delays plague supply chains, impacting production schedules ahead of the crucial Diwali season. Reports indicate bottlenecks at major ports like Jawaharlal Nehru Port Trust (J N P T) and Chennai Port, causing significant delays in the arrival of raw materials and finished goods.

unnormalised: “The current situation is reminiscent of the chaos portrayed in the film *Bhagam Bhag*, only this time it’s not a comedy for manufacturers,” commented Mr. Rajesh Kumar, CEO of a Gurgaon-based textile firm.
normalised: “The current situation is reminiscent of the chaos portrayed in the film *Bhagam Bhag*, only this time it’s not a comedy for manufacturers,” commented Mister Rajesh Kumar, chief executive officer of a Gurgaon-based textile firm.

unnormalised: The Indian Institute of Foreign Trade (IIFT) recently published a study highlighting that delays add an average of Rs. 5,000 per container in demurrage charges. The study also estimates that delays on key routes, like Mumbai to Kolkata (approx. 1,650 km), have increased by an average of 2 days. Government intervention is urged to streamline customs clearances and improve infrastructure to alleviate the growing pressure on the manufacturing sector. The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) is engaging with the Ministry of Commerce to find immediate solutions. Smaller enterprises are particularly vulnerable.
normalised: The Indian Institute of Foreign Trade (I I F T) recently published a study highlighting that delays add an average of rupee five thousand per container in demurrage charges. The study also estimates that delays on key routes, like Mumbai to Kolkata (approximately one thousand six hundred and fifty kilometer), have increased by an average of two days. Government intervention is urged to streamline customs clearances and improve infrastructure to alleviate the growing pressure on the manufacturing sector. The Confederation of Indian Industry (C I I) is engaging with the Ministry of Commerce to find immediate solutions. Smaller enterprises are particularly vulnerable.
